bucketPath.description: bucket path of the self storage location
bucketPath.name: bucketPath

confsOnly.description: export only the configs as per request parameters and don’t export any app data
confsOnly.name: confs_only

count.description: The maximum number of results to return.
count.name: count

defaultDirectory.description: export the default configs for the app etc/apps/<app_id>/default/*
defaultDirectory.name: default

feature.description: the feature the access rules apply towards
feature.name: feature

federatedSearchManage.description: Set Federated-Search-Manage-Ack to 'Y' to acknowledge your acceptance that roles with fsh_manage capability can send search results data outside the compliant environment
federatedSearchManage.name: Federated-Search-Manage-Ack

fromTime.description: The earliest time to return results from. Format is expected to be YYYY-MM-DD or in RFC3339. UTC is the default timezone.
fromTime.name: fromTime

localDirectory.description: export the local configs for the app under etc/apps/<app_id>/local/*
localDirectory.name: local

nextLink.description: The key for the next page of the result set. A nextLink with the value null indicates there are no more pages.
nextLink.name: nextLink

offset.description: The offset to start returning items from.
offset.name: offset

toTime.description: The latest time to return results from. Format is expected to be YYYY-MM-DD or in RFC3339. UTC is the default timezone.
toTime.name: toTime

usersDirectory.description: export the configs and data under etc/users/*/<app_id>/* for the users on which the requester has access over
usersDirectory.name: users

App.description: an splunk installed on the stack

CreateEcSsoPairingResponse.description: ID for pairing Splunk Cloud stack with Observability organization

id.description: the id of the latest deployment task

status.description: the status of the last deployment task, possible values are new, completed, pending, running, failed.

timestamp.description: timestamp of the latest deployment task

EnableObservabilityCapabilitiesResponse.description: CO2 spec value of the o11y key

GetEcSsoPairingStatusResponse.description: Status for pairing Splunk Cloud stack with Observability organization

appliesTo.description: Type of changes the change freeze applies to.

endDate.description: Date (YYYY/MM/DD) when the change freeze ends.

id.description: Unique identifier (UUID) of the change freeze. This field should be left empty for new change freezes.

startDate.description: Date (YYYY/MM/DD) when the change freeze starts.

appliesTo.description: Type of changes the change freeze applies to.

createdTimestamp.description: Time at which the change freeze was created.

endDate.description: Date (YYYY/MM/DD) when the change freeze ends.

lastModifiedTimestamp.description: Time at which the change freeze was last modified.

startDate.description: Date (YYYY/MM/DD) when the change freeze starts.

tickets.description: SFDC Tickets associated with the change freeze request.

SFDCTickets.description: List of SFDC tickets associated with the operation.

appName.description: Name of the app to be upgraded.

endTime.description: Time at which the operation ended.

metadata.description: A map containing metadata about the operation (e.g. targetVersion, lastStatusBeforeCanceled, etc...).

startTime.description: Time at which the operation started.

zeroDowntime.description: True if the operation will have no impact on the uptime of the stack.

duration.description: The duration of the maintenance window.

lastModifiedTimestamp.description: Time at which the maintenance window was last modified. Format is RFC3339.

lastSummary.description: The summary or reason for the maintenance.

mwType.description: The type of upgrade performed in the maintenance window.

requestedEntity.description: The entity which requested the maintenance window, either the customer or Splunk.

requestedUser.description: The user who requested the maintenance window.

scheduleStartTimestamp.description: Time at which the maintenance window is scheduled to begin. Format is RFC3339.

status.description: The status of the maintenance window schedule.

zeroDowntime.description: True if the maintenance window will have no impact on the uptime of the stack.

appliesTo.description: Type of changes the change freeze applies to.

createdTimestamp.description: Time at which the change freeze was created.

endDate.description: Date (YYYY/MM/DD) when the change freeze ends.

lastModifiedTimestamp.description: Time at which the change freeze was last modified.

startDate.description: Date (YYYY/MM/DD) when the change freeze starts.

tickets.description: Tickets associated with the change freeze request.

PatchSplunkbaseBody.description: the splunkbase app version to update.  If no version specified, the latest version will be installed.

PrivateAppBody.description: the app package in tgz format

SplunkbaseBody.description: the splunkbase app name and version to install. If no version specified, the latest version will be installed.

status.description: the status of the infrastructure 1) Ready - The stack is ready, and infrastructure is up to date. 2) Pending - The stack has some pending changes that haven't been applied to the stack yet. The changes could be internal system changes for stacks or user requested changes like modification to allow lists. 3) Failed - There were some errors while applying changes to the stacks were being applied. The changes could be internal system changes for stacks or user requested changes like modification to allow lists. User should reach out to Splunk support for resolution.

restartRequired.description: The stack has a notification to restart splunk server. User should restart stack via UI for all configurations to be completed. It may take some time for the correct state for restart-required field to be populated in a Search Head Cluster, given sync delays with different Search Heads

info.description: API for managing splunk cloud stacks. (c) 2020 Splunk Inc. All rights reserved. I acknowledge that Splunk is not responsible for the installation or use of any application that is not a supported Splunk application and Splunk specifically disclaims the accuracy, integrity, quality, legality, usefulness or security of such application or its use. Installation and use of an application that is not a supported Splunk application is at your own risk. Please note that if data leaves Splunk Cloud as a result of installing or using such application, Splunk’s security attestations do not apply to data outside Splunk Cloud. Learn more about installing private apps (link to https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/SplunkCloud/8.2.2109/Config/ManageApps). Access and use is subject to the Splunk General Terms (https://www.splunk.com/en_us/legal/splunk-general-terms.html) and Splunk's Website Terms and Conditions (https://www.splunk.com/en_us/legal/terms/terms-of-use.html).
